text: Now Peter and John were going up to the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.

And when they heard this, they entered the temple at daybreak and began to teach.

text: But when the officers came, they did not find them in the prison, so they returned and reported,

speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter and the apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men.

text: When they heard this, they were enraged and wanted to kill them.

text: But a Pharisee in the council named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law held in honour by all the people, stood up and gave orders to put the men outside for a little while.

text: And he said to them, “Men of Israel, take care what you are about to do with these men.

text: So in the present case I tell you, keep away from these men and let them alone, for if this plan or this undertaking is of man, it will fail;

text: but if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow them. You might even be found opposing God!” So they took his advice,

text: and when they had called in the apostles, they beat them and charged them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.

text: Then they left the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonour for the name.
speaker: Narrator

text: These they set before the apostles, and they prayed and laid their hands on them.

text: But they could not withstand the wisdom and the Spirit with which he was speaking.

text: And gazing at him, all who sat in the council saw that his face was like the face of an angel.

text:
And Stephen said:
“Brothers and fathers, hear me. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, ‘Go out from your land and from your kindred and go into the land that I will show you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he gave him no inheritance in it, not even a foot's length, but promised to give it to him as a possession and to his offspring after him, though he had no child.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Now there came a famine throughout all Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction, and our fathers could find no food.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers on their first visit.

text: And Joseph sent and summoned Jacob his father and all his kindred, seventy-five persons in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob went down into Egypt, and he died, he and our fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they were carried back to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham had bought for a sum of silver from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But as the time of the promise drew near, which God had granted to Abraham, the people increased and multiplied in Egypt
speaker: Narrator

text: until there arose over Egypt another king who did not know Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: He dealt shrewdly with our race and forced our fathers to expose their infants, so that they would not be kept alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: At this time Moses was born; and he was beautiful in God's sight. And he was brought up for three months in his father's house,
speaker: Narrator

text: and when he was exposed, Pharaoh's daughter adopted him and brought him up as her own son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and he was mighty in his words and deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brothers, the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And seeing one of them being wronged, he defended the oppressed man and avenged him by striking down the Egyptian.
speaker: Narrator

text: He supposed that his brothers would understand that God was giving them salvation by his hand, but they did not understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the following day he appeared to them as they were quarrelling and tried to reconcile them, saying, ‘Men, you are brothers. Why do you wrong each other?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the man who was wronging his neighbour thrust him aside, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you want to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’
speaker: Narrator

text: At this retort Moses fled and became an exile in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now when forty years had passed, an angel appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses saw it, he was amazed at the sight, and as he drew near to look, there came the voice of the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob.’ And Moses trembled and did not dare to look.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to him, ‘Take off the sandals from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have surely seen the affliction of my people who are in Egypt, and have heard their groaning, and I have come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send you to Egypt.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “This Moses, whom they rejected, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge?’—this man God sent as both ruler and redeemer by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: This man led them out, performing wonders and signs in Egypt and at the Red Sea and in the wilderness for forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the Moses who said to the Israelites, ‘God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your brothers.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the one who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him at Mount Sinai, and with our fathers. He received living oracles to give to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers refused to obey him, but thrust him aside, and in their hearts they turned to Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying to Aaron, ‘Make for us gods who will go before us. As for this Moses who led us out from the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made a calf in those days, and offered a sacrifice to the idol and were rejoicing in the works of their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But God turned away and gave them over to worship the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the prophets:
“‘Did you bring to me slain beasts and sacrifices,
    during the forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You took up the tent of Moloch
    and the star of your god Rephan,
    the images that you made to worship;
and I will send you into exile beyond Babylon.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Our fathers had the tent of witness in the wilderness, just as he who spoke to Moses directed him to make it, according to the pattern that he had seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers in turn brought it in with Joshua when they dispossessed the nations that God drove out before our fathers. So it was until the days of David,
speaker: Narrator

text: who found favour in the sight of God and asked to find a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it was Solomon who built a house for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the Most High does not dwell in houses made by hands, as the prophet says,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“‘Heaven is my throne,
    and the earth is my footstool.
What kind of house will you build for me, says the Lord,
    or what is the place of my rest?
speaker: Narrator

text: Did not my hand make all these things?’
speaker: Narrator

text: “You stiff-necked people, uncircumcised in heart and ears, you always resist the Holy Spirit. As your fathers did, so do you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which of the prophets did your fathers not persecute? And they killed those who announced beforehand the coming of the Righteous One, whom you have now betrayed and murdered,
speaker: Narrator

text: you who received the law as delivered by angels and did not keep it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they heard these things they were enraged, and they ground their teeth at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he, full of the Holy Spirit, gazed into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they cried out with a loud voice and stopped their ears and rushed together at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they cast him out of the city and stoned him. And the witnesses laid down their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they were stoning Stephen, he called out, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And falling to his knees he cried out with a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” And when he had said this, he fell asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And Saul approved of his execution.
And there arose on that day a great persecution against the church in Jerusalem, and they were all scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Devout men buried Stephen and made great lamentation over him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul was ravaging the church, and entering house after house, he dragged off men and women and committed them to prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now those who were scattered went about preaching the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and proclaimed to them the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the crowds with one accord paid attention to what was being said by Philip when they heard him and saw the signs that he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: For unclean spirits, crying out with a loud voice, came out of many who had them, and many who were paralysed or lame were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So there was much joy in that city.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there was a man named Simon, who had previously practised magic in the city and amazed the people of Samaria, saying that he himself was somebody great.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all paid attention to him, from the least to the greatest, saying, “This man is the power of God that is called Great.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they paid attention to him because for a long time he had amazed them with his magic.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they believed Philip as he preached good news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even Simon himself believed, and after being baptized he continued with Philip. And seeing signs and great miracles performed, he was amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the apostles at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent to them Peter and John,
speaker: Narrator

text: who came down and prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he had not yet fallen on any of them, but they had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they laid their hands on them and they received the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Simon saw that the Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles' hands, he offered them money,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Give me this power also, so that anyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said to him, “May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money!
speaker: Narrator

text: You have neither part nor lot in this matter, for your heart is not right before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Repent, therefore, of this wickedness of yours, and pray to the Lord that, if possible, the intent of your heart may be forgiven you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of iniquity.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Simon answered, “Pray for me to the Lord, that nothing of what you have said may come upon me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they had testified and spoken the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem, preaching the gospel to many villages of the Samaritans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip, “Rise and go towards the south to the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.” This is a desert place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he rose and went. And there was an Ethiopian, a eunuch, a court official of Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was in charge of all her treasure. He had come to Jerusalem to worship
speaker: Narrator

text: and was returning, seated in his chariot, and he was reading the prophet Isaiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit said to Philip, “Go over and join this chariot.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Philip ran to him and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet and asked, “Do you understand what you are reading?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “How can I, unless someone guides me?” And he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now the passage of the Scripture that he was reading was this:
“Like a sheep he was led to the slaughter
    and like a lamb before its shearer is silent,
    so he opens not his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In his humiliation justice was denied him.
    Who can describe his generation?
For his life is taken away from the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the eunuch said to Philip, “About whom, I ask you, does the prophet say this, about himself or about someone else?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Philip opened his mouth, and beginning with this Scripture he told him the good news about Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they were going along the road they came to some water, and the eunuch said, “See, here is water! What prevents me from being baptized?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded the chariot to stop, and they both went down into the water, Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord carried Philip away, and the eunuch saw him no more, and went on his way rejoicing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Philip found himself at Azotus, and as he passed through he preached the gospel to all the towns until he came to Caesarea.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul, still breathing threats and murder against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest
speaker: Narrator

text: and asked him for letters to the synagogues at Damascus, so that if he found any belonging to the Way, men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as he went on his way, he approached Damascus, and suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And falling to the ground he heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Who are you, Lord?” And he said, “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.
speaker: Narrator

text: But rise and enter the city, and you will be told what you are to do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The men who were travelling with him stood speechless, hearing the voice but seeing no one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul rose from the ground, and although his eyes were opened, he saw nothing. So they led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for three days he was without sight, and neither ate nor drank.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a disciple at Damascus named Ananias. The Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias.” And he said, “Here I am, Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to him, “Rise and go to the street called Straight, and at the house of Judas look for a man of Tarsus named Saul, for behold, he is praying,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he has seen in a vision a man named Ananias come in and lay his hands on him so that he might regain his sight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how much evil he has done to your saints at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on your name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to him, “Go, for he is a chosen instrument of mine to carry my name before the Gentiles and kings and the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will show him how much he must suffer for the sake of my name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Ananias departed and entered the house. And laying his hands on him he said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus who appeared to you on the road by which you came has sent me so that you may regain your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately something like scales fell from his eyes, and he regained his sight. Then he rose and was baptized;
speaker: Narrator

text:
and taking food, he was strengthened.
For some days he was with the disciples at Damascus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately he proclaimed Jesus in the synagogues, saying, “He is the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all who heard him were amazed and said, “Is not this the man who made havoc in Jerusalem of those who called upon this name? And has he not come here for this purpose, to bring them bound before the chief priests?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul increased all the more in strength, and confounded the Jews who lived in Damascus by proving that Jesus was the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: When many days had passed, the Jews plotted to kill him,
speaker: Narrator

text: but their plot became known to Saul. They were watching the gates day and night in order to kill him,
speaker: Narrator

text: but his disciples took him by night and let him down through an opening in the wall, lowering him in a basket.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had come to Jerusalem, he attempted to join the disciples. And they were all afraid of him, for they did not believe that he was a disciple.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles and declared to them how on the road he had seen the Lord, who spoke to him, and how at Damascus he had preached boldly in the name of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he went in and out among them at Jerusalem, preaching boldly in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he spoke and disputed against the Hellenists. But they were seeking to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the brothers learned this, they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the church throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace and was being built up. And walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, it multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as Peter went here and there among them all, he came down also to the saints who lived at Lydda.
speaker: Narrator

text: There he found a man named Aeneas, bedridden for eight years, who was paralysed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you; rise and make your bed.” And immediately he rose.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the residents of Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was in Joppa a disciple named Tabitha, which, translated, means Dorcas. She was full of good works and acts of charity.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days she became ill and died, and when they had washed her, they laid her in an upper room.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent two men to him, urging him, “Please come to us without delay.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter rose and went with them. And when he arrived, they took him to the upper room. All the widows stood beside him weeping and showing tunics and other garments that Dorcas made while she was with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter put them all outside, and knelt down and prayed; and turning to the body he said, “Tabitha, arise.” And she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter she sat up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gave her his hand and raised her up. Then calling the saints and widows, he presented her alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he stayed in Joppa for many days with one Simon, a tanner.
speaker: Narrator

text: At Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion of what was known as the Italian Cohort,
speaker: Narrator

text: a devout man who feared God with all his household, gave alms generously to the people, and prayed continually to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: About the ninth hour of the day he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God come in and say to him, “Cornelius.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he stared at him in terror and said, “What is it, Lord?” And he said to him, “Your prayers and your alms have ascended as a memorial before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now send men to Joppa and bring one Simon who is called Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is lodging with one Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the sea.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the angel who spoke to him had departed, he called two of his servants and a devout soldier from among those who attended him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having related everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day, as they were on their journey and approaching the city, Peter went up on the housetop about the sixth hour to pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he became hungry and wanted something to eat, but while they were preparing it, he fell into a trance
speaker: Narrator

text: and saw the heavens opened and something like a great sheet descending, being let down by its four corners upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In it were all kinds of animals and reptiles and birds of the air.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there came a voice to him: “Rise, Peter; kill and eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said, “By no means, Lord; for I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the voice came to him again a second time, “What God has made clean, do not call common.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened three times, and the thing was taken up at once to heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now while Peter was inwardly perplexed as to what the vision that he had seen might mean, behold, the men who were sent by Cornelius, having made enquiry for Simon's house, stood at the gate
speaker: Narrator

text: and called out to ask whether Simon who was called Peter was lodging there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And while Peter was pondering the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold, three men are looking for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise and go down and accompany them without hesitation, for I have sent them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter went down to the men and said, “I am the one you are looking for. What is the reason for your coming?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, “Cornelius, a centurion, an upright and God-fearing man, who is well spoken of by the whole Jewish nation, was directed by a holy angel to send for you to come to his house and to hear what you have to say.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he invited them in to be his guests.
The next day he rose and went away with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the following day they entered Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter entered, Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and worshipped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter lifted him up, saying, “Stand up; I too am a man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he talked with him, he went in and found many persons gathered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “You yourselves know how unlawful it is for a Jew to associate with or to visit anyone of another nation, but God has shown me that I should not call any person common or unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when I was sent for, I came without objection. I ask then why you sent for me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cornelius said, “Four days ago, about this hour, I was praying in my house at the ninth hour, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard and your alms have been remembered before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send therefore to Joppa and ask for Simon who is called Peter. He is lodging in the house of Simon, a tanner, by the sea.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So I sent for you at once, and you have been kind enough to come. Now therefore we are all here in the presence of God to hear all that you have been commanded by the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter opened his mouth and said: “Truly I understand that God shows no partiality,
speaker: Narrator

text: but in every nation anyone who fears him and does what is right is acceptable to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the word that he sent to Israel, preaching good news of peace through Jesus Christ (he is Lord of all),
speaker: Narrator

text: you yourselves know what happened throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee after the baptism that John proclaimed:
speaker: Narrator

text: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power. He went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we are witnesses of all that he did both in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem. They put him to death by hanging him on a tree,
speaker: Narrator

text: but God raised him on the third day and caused him to appear,
speaker: Narrator

text: not to all the people but to us who had been chosen by God as witnesses, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that he is the one appointed by God to be judge of the living and the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him all the prophets bear witness that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While Peter was still saying these things, the Holy Spirit fell on all who heard the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the believers from among the circumcised who had come with Peter were amazed, because the gift of the Holy Spirit was poured out even on the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they were hearing them speaking in tongues and extolling God. Then Peter declared,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Can anyone withhold water for baptizing these people, who have received the Holy Spirit just as we have?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to remain for some days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the apostles and the brothers who were throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, the circumcision party criticized him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You went to uncircumcised men and ate with them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter began and explained it to them in order:
speaker: Narrator

text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision, something like a great sheet descending, being let down from heaven by its four corners, and it came down to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Looking at it closely, I observed animals and beasts of prey and reptiles and birds of the air.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I heard a voice saying to me, ‘Rise, Peter; kill and eat.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said, ‘By no means, Lord; for nothing common or unclean has ever entered my mouth.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the voice answered a second time from heaven, ‘What God has made clean, do not call common.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened three times, and all was drawn up again into heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, at that very moment three men arrived at the house in which we were, sent to me from Caesarea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit told me to go with them, making no distinction. These six brothers also accompanied me, and we entered the man's house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he told us how he had seen the angel stand in his house and say, ‘Send to Joppa and bring Simon who is called Peter;
speaker: Narrator

text: he will declare to you a message by which you will be saved, you and all your household.’
speaker: Narrator

text: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them just as on us at the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
speaker: Narrator

text: If then God gave the same gift to them as he gave to us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I that I could stand in God's way?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard these things they fell silent. And they glorified God, saying, “Then to the Gentiles also God has granted repentance that leads to life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now those who were scattered because of the persecution that arose over Stephen travelled as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who on coming to Antioch spoke to the Hellenists also, preaching the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number who believed turned to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The report of this came to the ears of the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came and saw the grace of God, he was glad, and he exhorted them all to remain faithful to the Lord with steadfast purpose,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And a great many people were added to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul,
speaker: Narrator

text: and when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. For a whole year they met with the church and taught a great many people. And in Antioch the disciples were first called Christians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in these days prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of them named Agabus stood up and foretold by the Spirit that there would be a great famine over all the world (this took place in the days of Claudius).
speaker: Narrator

text: So the disciples determined, everyone according to his ability, to send relief to the brothers living in Judea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did so, sending it to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: About that time Herod the king laid violent hands on some who belonged to the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: He killed James the brother of John with the sword,
speaker: Narrator

text: and when he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter also. This was during the days of Unleavened Bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had seized him, he put him in prison, delivering him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him, intending after the Passover to bring him out to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter was kept in prison, but earnest prayer for him was made to God by the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Herod was about to bring him out, on that very night, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and sentries before the door were guarding the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, an angel of the Lord stood next to him, and a light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side and woke him, saying, “Get up quickly.” And the chains fell off his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel said to him, “Dress yourself and put on your sandals.” And he did so. And he said to him, “Wrap your cloak round you and follow me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went out and followed him. He did not know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had passed the first and the second guard, they came to the iron gate leading into the city. It opened for them of its own accord, and they went out and went along one street, and immediately the angel left him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter came to himself, he said, “Now I am sure that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from the hand of Herod and from all that the Jewish people were expecting.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he realized this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John whose other name was Mark, where many were gathered together and were praying.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he knocked at the door of the gateway, a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Recognizing Peter's voice, in her joy she did not open the gate but ran in and reported that Peter was standing at the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to her, “You are out of your mind.” But she kept insisting that it was so, and they kept saying, “It is his angel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter continued knocking, and when they opened, they saw him and were amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But motioning to them with his hand to be silent, he described to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, “Tell these things to James and to the brothers.” Then he departed and went to another place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when day came, there was no little disturbance among the soldiers over what had become of Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after Herod searched for him and did not find him, he examined the sentries and ordered that they should be put to death. Then he went down from Judea to Caesarea and spent time there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Herod was angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon, and they came to him with one accord, and having persuaded Blastus, the king's chamberlain, they asked for peace, because their country depended on the king's country for food.
speaker: Narrator

text: On an appointed day Herod put on his royal robes, took his seat upon the throne, and delivered an oration to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people were shouting, “The voice of a god, and not of a man!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him down, because he did not give God the glory, and he was eaten by worms and breathed his last.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of God increased and multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem when they had completed their service, bringing with them John, whose other name was Mark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were in the church at Antioch prophets and teachers, Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen a member of the court of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were worshipping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then after fasting and praying they laid their hands on them and sent them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia, and from there they sailed to Cyprus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they arrived at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they had John to assist them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had gone through the whole island as far as Paphos, they came upon a certain magician, a Jewish false prophet named Bar-Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, a man of intelligence, who summoned Barnabas and Saul and sought to hear the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Elymas the magician (for that is the meaning of his name) opposed them, seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul, who was also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked intently at him
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “You son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness, full of all deceit and villainy, will you not stop making crooked the straight paths of the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon you, and you will be blind and unable to see the sun for a time.” Immediately mist and darkness fell upon him, and he went about seeking people to lead him by the hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the proconsul believed, when he saw what had occurred, for he was astonished at the teaching of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Paul and his companions set sail from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia. And John left them and returned to Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: but they went on from Perga and came to Antioch in Pisidia. And on the Sabbath day they went into the synagogue and sat down.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent a message to them, saying, “Brothers, if you have any word of encouragement for the people, say it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So Paul stood up, and motioning with his hand said:
“Men of Israel and you who fear God, listen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers and made the people great during their stay in the land of Egypt, and with uplifted arm he led them out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for about forty years he put up with them in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after destroying seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: All this took about 450 years. And after that he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they asked for a king, and God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had removed him, he raised up David to be their king, of whom he testified and said, ‘I have found in David the son of Jesse a man after my heart, who will do all my will.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Of this man's offspring God has brought to Israel a Saviour, Jesus, as he promised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before his coming, John had proclaimed a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as John was finishing his course, he said, ‘What do you suppose that I am? I am not he. No, but behold, after me one is coming, the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to untie.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Brothers, sons of the family of Abraham, and those among you who fear God, to us has been sent the message of this salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who live in Jerusalem and their rulers, because they did not recognize him nor understand the utterances of the prophets, which are read every Sabbath, fulfilled them by condemning him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And though they found in him no guilt worthy of death, they asked Pilate to have him executed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had carried out all that was written of him, they took him down from the tree and laid him in a tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God raised him from the dead,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for many days he appeared to those who had come up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are now his witnesses to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we bring you the good news that what God promised to the fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text:
this he has fulfilled to us their children by raising Jesus, as also it is written in the second Psalm,
“‘You are my Son,
    today I have begotten you.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
And as for the fact that he raised him from the dead, no more to return to corruption, he has spoken in this way,
“‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore he says also in another psalm,
“‘You will not let your Holy One see corruption.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For David, after he had served the purpose of God in his own generation, fell asleep and was laid with his fathers and saw corruption,
speaker: Narrator

text: but he whom God raised up did not see corruption.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let it be known to you therefore, brothers, that through this man forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and by him everyone who believes is freed from everything from which you could not be freed by the law of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware, therefore, lest what is said in the Prophets should come about:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: As they went out, the people begged that these things might be told them the next Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the meeting of the synagogue broke up, many Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas, who, as they spoke with them, urged them to continue in the grace of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next Sabbath almost the whole city gathered to hear the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy and began to contradict what was spoken by Paul, reviling him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly, saying, “It was necessary that the word of God be spoken first to you. Since you thrust it aside and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we are turning to the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For so the Lord has commanded us, saying,
“‘I have made you a light for the Gentiles,
    that you may bring salvation to the ends of the earth.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Gentiles heard this, they began rejoicing and glorifying the word of the Lord, and as many as were appointed to eternal life believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord was spreading throughout the whole region.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Jews incited the devout women of high standing and the leading men of the city, stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and drove them out of their district.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they shook off the dust from their feet against them and went to Iconium.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at Iconium they entered together into the Jewish synagogue and spoke in such a way that a great number of both Jews and Greeks believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they remained for a long time, speaking boldly for the Lord, who bore witness to the word of his grace, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the people of the city were divided; some sided with the Jews and some with the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: When an attempt was made by both Gentiles and Jews, with their rulers, to mistreat them and to stone them,
speaker: Narrator

text: they learned of it and fled to Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and to the surrounding country,
speaker: Narrator

text: and there they continued to preach the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at Lystra there was a man sitting who could not use his feet. He was crippled from birth and had never walked.
speaker: Narrator

text: He listened to Paul speaking. And Paul, looking intently at him and seeing that he had faith to be made well,
speaker: Narrator

text: said in a loud voice, “Stand upright on your feet.” And he sprang up and began walking.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the crowds saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in Lycaonian, “The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul, Hermes, because he was the chief speaker.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest of Zeus, whose temple was at the entrance to the city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates and wanted to offer sacrifice with the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard of it, they tore their garments and rushed out into the crowd, crying out,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men, of like nature with you, and we bring you good news, that you should turn from these vain things to a living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all that is in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In past generations he allowed all the nations to walk in their own ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he did not leave himself without witness, for he did good by giving you rains from heaven and fruitful seasons, satisfying your hearts with food and gladness.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Even with these words they scarcely restrained the people from offering sacrifice to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jews came from Antioch and Iconium, and having persuaded the crowds, they stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city, supposing that he was dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the disciples gathered about him, he rose up and entered the city, and on the next day he went on with Barnabas to Derbe.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had preached the gospel to that city and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra and to Iconium and to Antioch,
speaker: Narrator

text: strengthening the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to continue in the faith, and saying that through many tribulations we must enter the kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had appointed elders for them in every church, with prayer and fasting they committed them to the Lord in whom they had believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they passed through Pisidia and came to Pamphylia.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from there they sailed to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work that they had fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they arrived and gathered the church together, they declared all that God had done with them, and how he had opened a door of faith to the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they remained no little time with the disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some men came down from Judea and were teaching the brothers, “Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses, you cannot be saved.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And after Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and debate with them, Paul and Barnabas and some of the others were appointed to go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and the elders about this question.
speaker: Narrator

text: So, being sent on their way by the church, they passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria, describing in detail the conversion of the Gentiles, and brought great joy to all the brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to Jerusalem, they were welcomed by the church and the apostles and the elders, and they declared all that God had done with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some believers who belonged to the party of the Pharisees rose up and said, “It is necessary to circumcise them and to order them to keep the law of Moses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The apostles and the elders were gathered together to consider this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after there had been much debate, Peter stood up and said to them, “Brothers, you know that in the early days God made a choice among you, that by my mouth the Gentiles should hear the word of the gospel and believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God, who knows the heart, bore witness to them, by giving them the Holy Spirit just as he did to us,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he made no distinction between us and them, having cleansed their hearts by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, therefore, why are you putting God to the test by placing a yoke on the neck of the disciples that neither our fathers nor we have been able to bear?
speaker: Narrator

text: But we believe that we will be saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus, just as they will.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the assembly fell silent, and they listened to Barnabas and Paul as they related what signs and wonders God had done through them among the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they finished speaking, James replied, “Brothers, listen to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simeon has related how God first visited the Gentiles, to take from them a people for his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with this the words of the prophets agree, just as it is written,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“‘After this I will return,
and I will rebuild the tent of David that has fallen;
I will rebuild its ruins,
     and I will restore it,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that the remnant of mankind may seek the Lord,
    and all the Gentiles who are called by my name,
     says the Lord, who makes these things
speaker: Narrator

text: known from of old.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my judgement is that we should not trouble those of the Gentiles who turn to God,
speaker: Narrator

text: but should write to them to abstain from the things polluted by idols, and from sexual immorality, and from what has been strangled, and from blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: For from ancient generations Moses has had in every city those who proclaim him, for he is read every Sabbath in the synagogues.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, with the whole church, to choose men from among them and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas. They sent Judas called Barsabbas, and Silas, leading men among the brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: with the following letter: “The brothers, both the apostles and the elders, to the brothers who are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia, greetings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since we have heard that some persons have gone out from us and troubled you with words, unsettling your minds, although we gave them no instructions,
speaker: Narrator

text: it has seemed good to us, having come to one accord, to choose men and send them to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
speaker: Narrator

text: men who have risked their lives for the sake of our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have therefore sent Judas and Silas, who themselves will tell you the same things by word of mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it has seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us to lay on you no greater burden than these requirements:
speaker: Narrator

text: that you abstain from what has been sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from what has been strangled, and from sexual immorality. If you keep yourselves from these, you will do well. Farewell.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So when they were sent off, they went down to Antioch, and having gathered the congregation together, they delivered the letter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had read it, they rejoiced because of its encouragement.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judas and Silas, who were themselves prophets, encouraged and strengthened the brothers with many words.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after they had spent some time, they were sent off in peace by the brothers to those who had sent them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after some days Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us return and visit the brothers in every city where we proclaimed the word of the Lord, and see how they are.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Barnabas wanted to take with them John called Mark.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Paul thought best not to take with them one who had withdrawn from them in Pamphylia and had not gone with them to the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there arose a sharp disagreement, so that they separated from each other. Barnabas took Mark with him and sailed away to Cyprus,
speaker: Narrator

text: but Paul chose Silas and departed, having been commended by the brothers to the grace of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul came also to Derbe and to Lystra. A disciple was there, named Timothy, the son of a Jewish woman who was a believer, but his father was a Greek.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was well spoken of by the brothers at Lystra and Iconium.
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul wanted Timothy to accompany him, and he took him and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those places, for they all knew that his father was a Greek.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they went on their way through the cities, they delivered to them for observance the decisions that had been reached by the apostles and elders who were in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the churches were strengthened in the faith, and they increased in numbers daily.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went through the region of Phrygia and Galatia, having been forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had come up to Mysia, they attempted to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit of Jesus did not allow them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So, passing by Mysia, they went down to Troas.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night: a man of Macedonia was standing there, urging him and saying, “Come over to Macedonia and help us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Paul had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go on into Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So, setting sail from Troas, we made a direct voyage to Samothrace, and the following day to Neapolis,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from there to Philippi, which is a leading city of the district of Macedonia and a Roman colony. We remained in this city some days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the Sabbath day we went outside the gate to the riverside, where we supposed there was a place of prayer, and we sat down and spoke to the women who had come together.
speaker: Narrator

text: One who heard us was a woman named Lydia, from the city of Thyatira, a seller of purple goods, who was a worshipper of God. The Lord opened her heart to pay attention to what was said by Paul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after she was baptized, and her household as well, she urged us, saying, “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come to my house and stay.” And she prevailed upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: As we were going to the place of prayer, we were met by a slave girl who had a spirit of divination and brought her owners much gain by fortune-telling.
speaker: Narrator

text: She followed Paul and us, crying out, “These men are servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to you the way of salvation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And this she kept doing for many days. Paul, having become greatly annoyed, turned and said to the spirit, “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her.” And it came out that very hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when her owners saw that their hope of gain was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the market-place before the rulers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had brought them to the magistrates, they said, “These men are Jews, and they are disturbing our city.
speaker: Narrator

text: They advocate customs that are not lawful for us as Romans to accept or practise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd joined in attacking them, and the magistrates tore the garments off them and gave orders to beat them with rods.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had inflicted many blows upon them, they threw them into prison, ordering the jailer to keep them safely.
speaker: Narrator

text: Having received this order, he put them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken. And immediately all the doors were opened, and everyone's bonds were unfastened.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the jailer woke and saw that the prison doors were open, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself, supposing that the prisoners had escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Paul cried with a loud voice, “Do not harm yourself, for we are all here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the jailer called for lights and rushed in, and trembling with fear he fell down before Paul and Silas.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he brought them out and said, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, “Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved, you and your household.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took them the same hour of the night and washed their wounds; and he was baptized at once, he and all his family.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he brought them up into his house and set food before them. And he rejoiced along with his entire household that he had believed in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when it was day, the magistrates sent the police, saying, “Let those men go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the jailer reported these words to Paul, saying, “The magistrates have sent to let you go. Therefore come out now and go in peace.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Paul said to them, “They have beaten us publicly, uncondemned, men who are Roman citizens, and have thrown us into prison; and do they now throw us out secretly? No! Let them come themselves and take us out.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The police reported these words to the magistrates, and they were afraid when they heard that they were Roman citizens.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they came and apologized to them. And they took them out and asked them to leave the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went out of the prison and visited Lydia. And when they had seen the brothers, they encouraged them and departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a synagogue of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Paul went in, as was his custom, and on three Sabbath days he reasoned with them from the Scriptures,
speaker: Narrator

text: explaining and proving that it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead, and saying, “This Jesus, whom I proclaim to you, is the Christ.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of them were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas, as did a great many of the devout Greeks and not a few of the leading women.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Jews were jealous, and taking some wicked men of the rabble, they formed a mob, set the city in an uproar, and attacked the house of Jason, seeking to bring them out to the crowd.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they could not find them, they dragged Jason and some of the brothers before the city authorities, shouting, “These men who have turned the world upside down have come here also,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jason has received them, and they are all acting against the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, Jesus.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people and the city authorities were disturbed when they heard these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had taken money as security from Jason and the rest, they let them go.
speaker: Narrator

text: The brothers immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Berea, and when they arrived they went into the Jewish synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these Jews were more noble than those in Thessalonica; they received the word with all eagerness, examining the Scriptures daily to see if these things were so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many of them therefore believed, with not a few Greek women of high standing as well as men.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Jews from Thessalonica learned that the word of God was proclaimed by Paul at Berea also, they came there too, agitating and stirring up the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the brothers immediately sent Paul off on his way to the sea, but Silas and Timothy remained there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who conducted Paul brought him as far as Athens, and after receiving a command for Silas and Timothy to come to him as soon as possible, they departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now while Paul was waiting for them at Athens, his spirit was provoked within him as he saw that the city was full of idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and the devout persons, and in the market-place every day with those who happened to be there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers also conversed with him. And some said, “What does this babbler wish to say?” Others said, “He seems to be a preacher of foreign divinities”—because he was preaching Jesus and the resurrection.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took him and brought him to the Areopagus, saying, “May we know what this new teaching is that you are presenting?
speaker: Narrator

text: For you bring some strange things to our ears. We wish to know therefore what these things mean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now all the Athenians and the foreigners who lived there would spend their time in nothing except telling or hearing something new.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Paul, standing in the midst of the Areopagus, said: “Men of Athens, I perceive that in every way you are very religious.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as I passed along and observed the objects of your worship, I found also an altar with this inscription, ‘To the unknown god.’ What therefore you worship as unknown, this I proclaim to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God who made the world and everything in it, being Lord of heaven and earth, does not live in temples made by man,
speaker: Narrator

text: nor is he served by human hands, as though he needed anything, since he himself gives to all mankind life and breath and everything.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made from one man every nation of mankind to live on all the face of the earth, having determined allotted periods and the boundaries of their dwelling place,
speaker: Narrator

text: that they should seek God, in the hope that they might feel their way towards him and find him. Yet he is actually not far from each one of us,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for
“‘In him we live and move and have our being’;
as even some of your own poets have said,
“‘For we are indeed his offspring.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Being then God's offspring, we ought not to think that the divine being is like gold or silver or stone, an image formed by the art and imagination of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: The times of ignorance God overlooked, but now he commands all people everywhere to repent,
speaker: Narrator

text: because he has fixed a day on which he will judge the world in righteousness by a man whom he has appointed; and of this he has given assurance to all by raising him from the dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked. But others said, “We will hear you again about this.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Paul went out from their midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some men joined him and believed, among whom also were Dionysius the Areopagite and a woman named Damaris and others with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this Paul left Athens and went to Corinth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he found a Jew named Aquila, a native of Pontus, recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to leave Rome. And he went to see them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and because he was of the same trade he stayed with them and worked, for they were tentmakers by trade.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath, and tried to persuade Jews and Greeks.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Silas and Timothy arrived from Macedonia, Paul was occupied with the word, testifying to the Jews that the Christ was Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they opposed and reviled him, he shook out his garments and said to them, “Your blood be on your own heads! I am innocent. From now on I will go to the Gentiles.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he left there and went to the house of a man named Titius Justus, a worshipper of God. His house was next door to the synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed in the Lord, together with his entire household. And many of the Corinthians hearing Paul believed and were baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to Paul one night in a vision, “Do not be afraid, but go on speaking and do not be silent,
speaker: Narrator

text: for I am with you, and no one will attack you to harm you, for I have many in this city who are my people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he stayed a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews made a united attack on Paul and brought him before the tribunal,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “This man is persuading people to worship God contrary to the law.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews, “If it were a matter of wrongdoing or vicious crime, O Jews, I would have reason to accept your complaint.
speaker: Narrator

text: But since it is a matter of questions about words and names and your own law, see to it yourselves. I refuse to be a judge of these things.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he drove them from the tribunal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they all seized Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, and beat him in front of the tribunal. But Gallio paid no attention to any of this.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Paul stayed many days longer and then took leave of the brothers and set sail for Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila. At Cenchreae he had cut his hair, for he was under a vow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Ephesus, and he left them there, but he himself went into the synagogue and reasoned with the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they asked him to stay for a longer period, he declined.
speaker: Narrator

text: But on taking leave of them he said, “I will return to you if God wills”, and he set sail from Ephesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had landed at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the church, and then went down to Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: After spending some time there, he departed and went from one place to the next through the region of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a Jew named Apollos, a native of Alexandria, came to Ephesus. He was an eloquent man, competent in the Scriptures.
speaker: Narrator

text: He had been instructed in the way of the Lord. And being fervent in spirit, he spoke and taught accurately the things concerning Jesus, though he knew only the baptism of John.
speaker: Narrator

text: He began to speak boldly in the synagogue, but when Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him and explained to him the way of God more accurately.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he wished to cross to Achaia, the brothers encouraged him and wrote to the disciples to welcome him. When he arrived, he greatly helped those who through grace had believed,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he powerfully refuted the Jews in public, showing by the Scriptures that the Christ was Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul passed through the inland country and came to Ephesus. There he found some disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed?” And they said, “No, we have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Into what then were you baptized?” They said, “Into John's baptism.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Paul said, “John baptized with the baptism of repentance, telling the people to believe in the one who was to come after him, that is, Jesus.”
speaker: Narrator

text: On hearing this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Paul had laid his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came on them, and they began speaking in tongues and prophesying.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were about twelve men in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he entered the synagogue and for three months spoke boldly, reasoning and persuading them about the kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when some became stubborn and continued in unbelief, speaking evil of the Way before the congregation, he withdrew from them and took the disciples with him, reasoning daily in the hall of Tyrannus.
speaker: Narrator

text: This continued for two years, so that all the residents of Asia heard the word of the Lord, both Jews and Greeks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God was doing extraordinary miracles by the hands of Paul,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that even handkerchiefs or aprons that had touched his skin were carried away to the sick, and their diseases left them and the evil spirits came out of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of the itinerant Jewish exorcists undertook to invoke the name of the Lord Jesus over those who had evil spirits, saying, “I adjure you by the Jesus whom Paul proclaims.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven sons of a Jewish high priest named Sceva were doing this.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the evil spirit answered them, “Jesus I know, and Paul I recognize, but who are you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man in whom was the evil spirit leaped on them, mastered all of them and overpowered them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this became known to all the residents of Ephesus, both Jews and Greeks. And fear fell upon them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was extolled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also many of those who were now believers came, confessing and divulging their practices.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a number of those who had practised magic arts brought their books together and burned them in the sight of all. And they counted the value of them and found it came to fifty thousand pieces of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the word of the Lord continued to increase and prevail mightily.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after these events Paul resolved in the Spirit to pass through Macedonia and Achaia and go to Jerusalem, saying, “After I have been there, I must also see Rome.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And having sent into Macedonia two of his helpers, Timothy and Erastus, he himself stayed in Asia for a while.
speaker: Narrator

text: About that time there arose no little disturbance concerning the Way.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a man named Demetrius, a silversmith, who made silver shrines of Artemis, brought no little business to the craftsmen.
speaker: Narrator

text: These he gathered together, with the workmen in similar trades, and said, “Men, you know that from this business we have our wealth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you see and hear that not only in Ephesus but in almost all of Asia this Paul has persuaded and turned away a great many people, saying that gods made with hands are not gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there is danger not only that this trade of ours may come into disrepute but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis may be counted as nothing, and that she may even be deposed from her magnificence, she whom all Asia and the world worship.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard this they were enraged and were crying out, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the city was filled with the confusion, and they rushed together into the theatre, dragging with them Gaius and Aristarchus, Macedonians who were Paul's companions in travel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Paul wished to go in among the crowd, the disciples would not let him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And even some of the Asiarchs, who were friends of his, sent to him and were urging him not to venture into the theatre.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now some cried out one thing, some another, for the assembly was in confusion, and most of them did not know why they had come together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the crowd prompted Alexander, whom the Jews had put forward. And Alexander, motioning with his hand, wanted to make a defence to the crowd.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they recognized that he was a Jew, for about two hours they all cried out with one voice, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the town clerk had quietened the crowd, he said, “Men of Ephesus, who is there who does not know that the city of the Ephesians is temple keeper of the great Artemis, and of the sacred stone that fell from the sky?
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing then that these things cannot be denied, you ought to be quiet and do nothing rash.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have brought these men here who are neither sacrilegious nor blasphemers of our goddess.
speaker: Narrator

text: If therefore Demetrius and the craftsmen with him have a complaint against anyone, the courts are open, and there are proconsuls. Let them bring charges against one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you seek anything further, it shall be settled in the regular assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we really are in danger of being charged with rioting today, since there is no cause that we can give to justify this commotion.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had said these things, he dismissed the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the uproar ceased, Paul sent for the disciples, and after encouraging them, he said farewell and departed for Macedonia.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had gone through those regions and had given them much encouragement, he came to Greece.
speaker: Narrator

text: There he spent three months, and when a plot was made against him by the Jews as he was about to set sail for Syria, he decided to return through Macedonia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sopater the Berean, son of Pyrrhus, accompanied him; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timothy; and the Asians, Tychicus and Trophimus.
speaker: Narrator

text: These went on ahead and were waiting for us at Troas,
speaker: Narrator

text: but we sailed away from Philippi after the days of Unleavened Bread, and in five days we came to them at Troas, where we stayed for seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the first day of the week, when we were gathered together to break bread, Paul talked with them, intending to depart on the next day, and he prolonged his speech until midnight.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were many lamps in the upper room where we were gathered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a young man named Eutychus, sitting at the window, sank into a deep sleep as Paul talked still longer. And being overcome by sleep, he fell down from the third storey and was taken up dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Paul went down and bent over him, and taking him in his arms, said, “Do not be alarmed, for his life is in him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Paul had gone up and had broken bread and eaten, he conversed with them a long while, until daybreak, and so departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took the youth away alive, and were not a little comforted.
speaker: Narrator

text: But going ahead to the ship, we set sail for Assos, intending to take Paul aboard there, for so he had arranged, intending himself to go by land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he met us at Assos, we took him on board and went to Mitylene.
speaker: Narrator

text: And sailing from there we came the following day opposite Chios; the next day we touched at Samos; and the day after that we went to Miletus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus, so that he might not have to spend time in Asia, for he was hastening to be at Jerusalem, if possible, on the day of Pentecost.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now from Miletus he sent to Ephesus and called the elders of the church to come to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And when they came to him, he said to them:
“You yourselves know how I lived among you the whole time from the first day that I set foot in Asia,
speaker: Narrator

text: serving the Lord with all humility and with tears and with trials that happened to me through the plots of the Jews;
speaker: Narrator

text: how I did not shrink from declaring to you anything that was profitable, and teaching you in public and from house to house,
speaker: Narrator

text: testifying both to Jews and to Greeks of repentance towards God and of faith in our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, behold, I am going to Jerusalem, constrained by the Spirit, not knowing what will happen to me there,
speaker: Narrator

text: except that the Holy Spirit testifies to me in every city that imprisonment and afflictions await me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I do not account my life of any value nor as precious to myself, if only I may finish my course and the ministry that I received from the Lord Jesus, to testify to the gospel of the grace of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, behold, I know that none of you among whom I have gone about proclaiming the kingdom will see my face again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I testify to you this day that I am innocent of the blood of all of you,
speaker: Narrator

text: for I did not shrink from declaring to you the whole counsel of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pay careful attention to yourselves and to all the flock, of which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to care for the church of God, which he obtained with his own blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know that after my departure fierce wolves will come in among you, not sparing the flock;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from among your own selves will arise men speaking twisted things, to draw away the disciples after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore be alert, remembering that for three years I did not cease night or day to admonish everyone with tears.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now I commend you to God and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up and to give you the inheritance among all those who are sanctified.
speaker: Narrator

text: I coveted no one's silver or gold or apparel.
speaker: Narrator

text: You yourselves know that these hands ministered to my necessities and to those who were with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all things I have shown you that by working hard in this way we must help the weak and remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he himself said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”
speaker: Narrator
